goal.ch:
In this course, students will expect to: 

Communicate fluently and effectively  

Cultivate a critical understanding of the English language in the context of storytelling marketing 

Participate in various in-class presentations (individual and group) and develop a sense of linguistic community

outline.ch: This is a public speaking class. Its goal is to train students to communicate with people on a specific topic in a public forum using a formal presentation style. Students will learn presentation skills in relation to speech structure, storytelling techniques, visual aids, body language, etc. The course will place extra emphases on building the skill set for Storytelling Marketing: a specific marketing model built on the manipulation of storytelling by bringing together facts, emotions, and a specific group of audience. Students who take this course should expect to conduct individual project or group presentation on a regular basis throughout the semester.

gradMethod.ch:
For this course, there will be no written assignment. Grades will be calculated based on the following criteria: 

Attendance                                                                                                     10％
Participation                                                                                                   20％
Show and Tell Presentation                                                                           20％
Midterm Presentation                                                                                    25％
Final Presentation                                                                                          25％                                


Attendance (10％) 

Attendance-wise, the instructor will take attendance every week (Yes, I will!). Each student is allowed up to 3 absences throughout the semester (no proof needed; however, we do recommend that you reserve at least one for unexpected sick leave). Starting from the fourth absence, permission from the instructor is needed in advance, or else it will lead to a failing grade (below 60).



Participation (20％)

Considering that most of our class time will be devoted to cultivating students’ ability to express themselves in English and in a professional manner, active participation is required. Being quiet in class will reflect negatively on the final grade. Note: This class has ZERO tolerance for multi-tasking. Please have the courtesy to avoid checking your phone during class time (Do it during the break!). Your attendance of the day will be discounted if you are caught texting in class (and I mean it!). 


Show and Tell Presentation (individual) (20％)
Each student will be asked to pick an image ad from a brand/company and do a formal presentation on its brand identity with Sinek’s Golden Circle Theory. More prompts will be given in class. 


Midterm Presentation (group) (25％)
Midterm exam will take the form of a group presentation (2-3 people). Each group will have to come up with an image ad pitch for a brand assigned by the instructor. Each group will need to make a short ad (no more than 3 mins) and do a formal presentation on its rationale.  


Final Presentation (group) (25％)
Final exam will take the form of a group presentation (2-3 people). Each group will create its own brand and products via an Instagram account. The catalog must be more than 5 products, and the group will conduct a presentation in the form of a brand-launching press conference with slides and pamphlets.
